requirement_tested: Implement a search functionality allowing users to input stock codes or names
user_persona: A financial analyst who needs quick access to stock data.
user_goal: To find the stock information for 'AAPL' by entering its code into the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: The user opens the website and sees a centered search bar with a placeholder prompting them to enter a stock code or name.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the search bar on the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A search bar with the placeholder 'Enter stock code or name' is visible, styled with a white background and navy border.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Stock Code
narrative_steps.description: The user types 'AAPL' into the search bar to look up Apple Inc.'s stock information.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'AAPL' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The text 'AAPL' appears in the search input field.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Search
narrative_steps.description: After typing the stock code, the user clicks the search icon to initiate the search process.
narrative_steps.action: Click the search icon next to the input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system processes the query and redirects the user to the dashboard for AAPL stock.

requirement_tested: Provide auto-suggest or autocomplete feature for stock search input
user_persona: A new investor exploring different stocks.
user_goal: To quickly locate 'Microsoft Corporation' using the autocomplete suggestions while typing.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Search
narrative_steps.description: The user begins typing 'Microsoft' into the search bar to find the company's stock details.
narrative_steps.action: Begin typing 'Microsoft' in the search input.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dropdown menu appears below the search bar showing matching stock suggestions dynamically.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Suggestions
narrative_steps.description: As the user continues typing, several matching companies appear in the suggestion list. They notice 'Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)' among the options.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the autocomplete suggestions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Suggestions like 'Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)' are displayed with navy text on a white background.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Suggested Stock
narrative_steps.description: The user hovers over the suggested entry to highlight it and then clicks it to proceed.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over 'Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)', then click the suggestion.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The search bar populates with 'MSFT' and navigates to the Microsoft stock dashboard.

requirement_tested: Create a dashboard displaying basic stock information including company name, ticker symbol, and current price
user_persona: An active trader checking key stock metrics at a glance.
user_goal: To verify the current price and basic info of Tesla Inc. (TSLA).

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: The user searches for TSLA and lands on the stock dashboard page.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the TSLA stock dashboard after searching.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard loads with a responsive grid layout featuring cards for essential stock information.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Basic Information
narrative_steps.description: On the dashboard, the user looks for the company name, ticker symbol, and current price.
narrative_steps.action: Scan the dashboard for relevant information cards.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Three distinct cards show 'Company Name: Tesla Inc.', 'Ticker Symbol: TSLA', and 'Current Price: $250.75', all styled with white background and navy text.

requirement_tested: Include market trends visualization with interactive charts showing historical price movements
user_persona: A portfolio manager analyzing long-term performance.
user_goal: To review Tesla's price movement over the past six months using the interactive chart.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Market Trends Section
narrative_steps.description: The user scrolls down to the Market Trends section on the Tesla stock dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the Market Trends chart area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An interactive area chart titled 'Market Trends' is displayed with dates on the x-axis and prices on the y-axis.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Chart
narrative_steps.description: The user hovers over various points on the chart to inspect specific price values.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over different points on the chart line.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltips appear showing exact date and price value at each hovered point.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Time Range
narrative_steps.description: Wanting a clearer view, the user selects the '6 Months' option to narrow the displayed data range.
narrative_steps.action: Click the '6 Months' time range filter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The chart updates to display only the last six months of price movements.

requirement_tested: Display comprehensive financial data including revenue, earnings, and key financial ratios
user_persona: A financial researcher conducting due diligence.
user_goal: To analyze Tesla's latest quarterly financials including revenue and P/E ratio.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Financial Data Table
narrative_steps.description: The user scrolls further down to find the financial data section on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the financial data table.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tabular representation of financial data is presented with labeled columns such as Revenue, Earnings, EPS, P/E Ratio, etc.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Key Metrics
narrative_steps.description: The user scans the rows to identify Tesla's revenue and P/E ratio figures.
narrative_steps.action: Read values under the Revenue and P/E Ratio columns.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tesla's revenue is listed as $20B and P/E ratio as 45.3x, styled with alternating row colors and navy headers.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Financial Data
narrative_steps.description: To compare performance, the user decides to sort the table by earnings in descending order.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Earnings' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The table reorders itself with the highest earning entries appearing first.

requirement_tested: Offer customizable report generation options based on user-selected parameters
user_persona: A client advisor preparing tailored investment summaries.
user_goal: To generate a report focusing solely on financial data and market trends for Tesla.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Report Options
narrative_steps.description: The user finds the report customization section beneath the financial data table.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the report generation form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Toggle switches or checkboxes labeled Basic Info, Market Trends, Financial Data, and Company Profile are visible.

narrative_steps.title: Customizing Content Selection
narrative_steps.description: The user deselects Basic Info and Company Profile, leaving only Market Trends and Financial Data checked.
narrative_steps.action: Uncheck Basic Info and Company Profile; keep Market Trends and Financial Data selected.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only the selected sections will be included in the generated report.

narrative_steps.title: Preparing Report Generation
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the selections, the user prepares to click the Generate Report button.
narrative_steps.action: Prepare to click the Generate Report button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system recognizes the selected content preferences for inclusion in the report.

requirement_tested: Provide report format selection including PDF, HTML, and spreadsheet export options
user_persona: A compliance officer requiring formal documentation.
user_goal: To export the customized Tesla stock report in PDF format.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Export Format
narrative_steps.description: Before generating the report, the user specifies they want it exported as a PDF.
narrative_steps.action: Open the format selector dropdown and choose PDF.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dropdown menu reveals options PDF, HTML, and Spreadsheet. After selecting PDF, it becomes the default choice.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Format Choice
narrative_steps.description: The user confirms that PDF is selected before proceeding with report creation.
narrative_steps.action: Verify that 'PDF' is selected in the format dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dropdown closes and shows 'PDF' as the chosen format beside the Generate Report button.

requirement_tested: Include content customization options allowing users to choose which sections to include in reports
user_persona: A marketing associate needing targeted insights.
user_goal: To create a simplified report excluding detailed financials but including market trends.

narrative_steps.title: Deselecting Sections
narrative_steps.description: In the report configuration panel, the user unchips the Financial Data checkbox.
narrative_steps.action: Uncheck the 'Financial Data' toggle switch.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The Financial Data section is removed from the report preview or generation queue.

narrative_steps.title: Finalizing Preferences
narrative_steps.description: The user verifies that only Market Trends remains selected before initiating report generation.
narrative_steps.action: Double-check remaining toggles—only Market Trends should be active.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system registers that only Market Trends should be included in the final report.

requirement_tested: Implement automatic report generation engine that compiles selected data into formatted reports
user_persona: An operations lead automating weekly reports.
user_goal: To generate a fully compiled Tesla stock report based on previous selections.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Report Creation
narrative_steps.description: Having configured content and format, the user clicks the Generate Report button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Generate Report button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend service starts compiling the requested data using predefined templates.

narrative_steps.title: Awaiting Completion
narrative_steps.description: The user waits briefly as the system processes and formats the report internally.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for processing completion indicator.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A loading spinner or progress bar indicates ongoing report compilation.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Generated Report
narrative_steps.description: Once complete, the system presents a downloadable version of the report.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the appearance of the Download button/link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A Download link or button becomes enabled, ready to deliver the finished report file.

requirement_tested: Create a clean user interface with white background and navy-colored components as specified
user_persona: A UX designer validating UI consistency.
user_goal: To ensure the entire application maintains the required color scheme of white background and navy components.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Overall Design
narrative_steps.description: The user navigates through multiple pages to assess visual consistency.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the homepage, search results, and stock dashboard pages.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All pages maintain a white background with navy-colored headers, buttons, and active states throughout.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Focusing on individual elements like forms, buttons, and charts, the user checks for proper color usage.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect the colors of form inputs, buttons, and chart lines.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Inputs have navy borders, buttons use navy fill, and chart lines follow #000080 color standard.

requirement_tested: Add sorting and filtering capabilities for financial data and market trend information
user_persona: A quantitative analyst comparing stock performances.
user_goal: To sort Tesla’s financial data by P/E Ratio in ascending order.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Sort Controls
narrative_steps.description: The user identifies the sort icon next to the P/E Ratio column header and clicks it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the sort icon adjacent to the P/E Ratio column.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dropdown menu with sort options (ascending/descending) opens up.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Ascending Sort
narrative_steps.description: From the dropdown, the user chooses to sort by ascending order to see lower P/E stocks first.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Sort Ascending' from the dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The financial data table reorders with the lowest P/E Ratio entries appearing at the top.

requirement_tested: Include real-time or delayed stock price updates
user_persona: A day trader monitoring intraday movements.
user_goal: To observe Tesla’s stock price updating automatically every five minutes.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Current Price
narrative_steps.description: The user keeps the Tesla dashboard open to monitor the current price displayed on the main card.
narrative_steps.action: Stay on the dashboard viewing the 'Current Price' card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The price figure updates automatically every 5 minutes without manual refresh.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Update Timestamp
narrative_steps.description: The user notes the timestamp next to the updated price to confirm recency.
narrative_steps.action: Check the timestamp label beside the current price.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A small note indicating 'Last Updated: HH:MM AM/PM' reflects the most recent fetch.

requirement_tested: Provide company profile section with business description and key executives
user_goal: To read about Tesla’s business model and learn about its CEO.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Company Profile
narrative_steps.description: The user scrolls to the bottom of the Tesla dashboard to find the Company Profile section.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the Company Profile section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A titled section labeled 'Company Profile' displays descriptive text, industry, headquarters, and executive info.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Business Overview
narrative_steps.description: The user reads the introductory paragraph summarizing Tesla’s mission and core business activities.
narrative_steps.action: Read the company description paragraph.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A well-formatted paragraph outlines Tesla's focus on electric vehicles and sustainable energy solutions.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Leadership
narrative_steps.description: Curious about leadership, the user looks for the CEO's name and other board members listed.
narrative_steps.action: Scan for the CEO and board member listings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: CEO Elon Musk is clearly identified along with a list of other key executives.

requirement_tested: Implement bookmarking or watchlist feature for users to track multiple stocks
user_persona: A retiree managing a diversified portfolio.
user_goal: To add Tesla (TSLA) to their personal watchlist for easier tracking.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Bookmark Icon
narrative_steps.description: While viewing Tesla’s dashboard, the user notices a bookmark icon near the top right corner.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the bookmark icon on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A bookmark icon resembling '/icons/bookmark-outline.svg' is visible.

narrative_steps.title: Adding to Watchlist
narrative_steps.description: The user clicks the outline icon to save Tesla to their watchlist.
narrative_steps.action: Click the bookmark icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The icon changes to a filled version ('/icons/bookmark-filled.svg'), confirming addition to the watchlist.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Persistence
narrative_steps.description: Returning later, the user verifies that Tesla still appears in their watchlist.
narrative_steps.action: Return to the watchlist or revisit Tesla dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The bookmark icon remains filled, and Tesla persists in stored watchlist items.

requirement_tested: Add export functionality to save generated reports to user's device
user_persona: A department head sharing findings with colleagues.
user_goal: To download a generated Tesla stock report directly to their computer.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Final Report
narrative_steps.description: After configuring preferences, the user clicks Generate Report and waits for it to finish.
narrative_steps.action: Click Generate Report and wait for processing.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A success message appears along with a Download link or button.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Download
narrative_steps.description: Ready to share the report, the user clicks the Download button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Download button/link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser prompts the user to save the file locally using the native download dialog.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Locally
narrative_steps.description: The user saves the downloaded PDF to their desktop folder.
narrative_steps.action: Choose save location and confirm download.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The report file is successfully saved to the user's device in the selected directory.
